185541608.review:
Zagraj jeżeli lubisz:
• taktyczną walkę
• decyzje mające konsekwencje
• zarządzanie zasobami

W grze wcielamy się w przywódcę grupy wikingów. W drużynie mamy postacie i są z nimi interakcje, dostatecznie liczne, by mieć pewien ich obraz i by uzupełniało to grę, ale nie są one jednak zbyt liczne i nie stanowią osi rozgrywki.

To co wyróżnia tę grę (i możliwe, że Expeditions), to zarządzanie zasobami i decyzjami. Grę można przegrać poza walką, bo drużyna ma zasoby takie, jak medykamenty, jedzenie czy drewno, które są potrzebne, a których może nam zabraknąć, jeśli o nie nie zadbamy. Jednocześnie jednak poziom trudności nie jest tu jakiś bardzo wyśrubowany.

W grę dobrze się gra unikając wczytywania. Dzięki temu decyzje - i w walce i poza - są ciekawsze. W grze zwykle przegranie starcia nie kończy jej, więc można sobie na to pozwolić.

To nie jest gra z budżetem AAA i to widać, ale ten budżet, który miała, został dobrze spożytkowany.

Jak krótko ją określić, jest to połączenie Baldur's Gate z XCOM – ale tylko trochę :)

185397856.review:
[h1] I just finished this game and I thoroughly enjoyed it. That being said, there are gameplay mechanics and small issues that could lead to some frustration for the unprepared or unwilling. [/h1]

	Bad stuff first. The most annoying thing in this entire game is trying to get the little hand cursor to appear to pick up loot. You will find yourself messing with the camera to poke through barrels and chests constantly. 

This game has a time limit. I strongly dislike time limits in my games, but the good news is that I had more than enough time and that was with me going back and forth to Denmark a bunch and generally goofing off. Don’t overdo it with the camping, and you can really stretch the time limit quite a bit.

As for the camera, it simply does not zoom out enough, but other than that, it’s easy enough to move it to your liking.
	
This is just a minor gripe but one more bit of jank. Sometimes you won’t be able to equip items and you have to leave the inventory menu and come back to resolve it. Not a gamebreaker by any means, but irritating, nonetheless.
	
The gameplay itself is very good, but I did have to restart as I didn’t quite understand the systems at work with SP and resource management. You want each of your hirdmen to only specialize in one or two weapons. This rule goes for most skills (1 or 2 support skills, etc.) If you attempt to make a jack of all trades, you are going to struggle on medium difficulty or above. When you start acquiring extra hirdmen, make sure you pick one to heal, one to tinker and craft, etc. You will have enough party members to pimp out camp. One more thing I wish I knew when I started, without the use of thralls, you will have a difficult time doing everything you want in your homestead, so it is good to focus on either power or prosperity as opposed to both (I used no thralls for the entire game).
	
Dialogue options in this game are many and meaningful. You have characters with personality, everything is well written, and the number of dialogue options can be dizzying for somebody who locks up at A or B style questions. The hirdmen’s dialogue is well written and the story is interesting. There are even a few mysteries left that I didn’t uncover…

Now for the meat and potatoes, the battle system. In short, it’s excellent. You will be killed and probably more than once, but once you learn how to use the battlefield and when to deploy traps or use skills, the game becomes a thrill ride. There is an excellent cover system at work here as well, and you can hide units behind hirdmen with shields, as well as obstacles. You are going to want to do this, as archers are DEADLY and can wipe out a party quickly. 

In general, you want to utilize cover and deploy skills to limit the accuracy of ranged units. While doing this, you want your sword (or axe) and boards to block access to your archers, healers, etc. utilizing unit placement to also force archers to waste turns on tactical moves. It is all really well done, and once you get the hang of it, it is really fun.

So, yeah, Expeditions: Viking, it’s really good. I’m jumping back into Conquistadors next!

185151683.review: Steep learning curve. Fun ride tho

185013285.review: An enjoyable game, I would have liked it to be a bit longer!

184999368.review:
ВЕЛИКАЯ ИГРА!
Прошёл её за пару недель, до сих пор под впечатлением. Напомнила мне ощущения от первого Baldur's Gate — в хорошем смысле. Настоящая классическая партийная RPG, в которой можно отыгрывать викинга-отморозка.
Я грабил монастыри, ломал кресты, уничтожал всё, что попадалось на пути. Получил достижение "Великая языческая армия", уничтожив и пиктов, и Нортумбрию, а заодно сломал все кресты в игре, выбив одно из самых редких достижений. 
Жаль, что подобных игр так мало. Предыдущая часть серии, Expeditions: Conquistador – странненькая тактика. А следующая, Expeditions: Rome, зачем-то ушла в стратегию с армиями. Потом студия и вовсе закрылась. А вот Expeditions: Viking — это малоизвестный бриллиант жанра.
Кстати, неожиданно игра напомнила мне Rogue Trader от Owlcat Games. И по композиции повествования, и по подходу к геймплею, и по структуре... Только вот это — Rogue Trader здорового человека: на 40 часов, а не на 130.
Особенно запомнился момент высадки на Британию. Причаливаю с отрядом к деревне, нас встречает местная делегация, что-то говорят на непонятном языке. В отряде есть парень, который вроде как может перевести. Но я решил поступить как викинг — после реплики «эй, похоже они решили сделать нам что-то нехорошее» мой хирд вырезал всех. Разграбил и вырезал всю деревню, разграбил монастырь, сломал кресты и обрадовался золоту.
Честно говоря, не знаю, каков опыт от этой игры, если нормально разговаривать с людьми и выполнять квесты. Я играл отморозком, и мне было весело. Игра предоставляет массу возможностей для отыгрыша поехавшего викинга-гопника во славу Тюра.
Романтические линии — тоже огонь. За одно прохождение я умудрился жениться на охотнице, переспать с ведьмой и получить предложение от местной дамы в одном из городов. Правда, после того как я вышел из её дома довольный, моя охотница посмотрела на меня испепеляющим взглядом, и отношения упали на -10. Пришлось загружаться — совесть замучила, невеста все-таки…
Шутка! Я же викинг. Немного побузила, но простила. В итоге: три женщины за одно прохождение — чек. Ах да, после ночи с той дамочкой мне прилетело "воспаление паха". Вывод: с ней, похоже, половина Британии уже успела переболеть...

184949823.review: Zacne. Dość wymagające. Czuć fajny klimat.

184486726.review:
I was pleasantly surprised by this game.  The strong storyline really drew me in, and had me role playing as the son of a dead thegn trying to restore his father's territory to greatness.  That sounds trite, but, not all game stories are compelling.  Some are just a bland pretext to play the mechanics of the game.  In this case, the game is the pretext to tell the story,  I appreciate that.

Sure, there were a few warts, such as clunky UI components, trying to find the right pixel to loot objects, poor buff and debuff tooltips, quests that can be unintentionally blocked from completion if you discover them in the wrong order, consequences that weren't fully explained before a choice, etc.  

But overall, I felt this turn-based tactical combat game really explored the culture and morality of being a viking during their heyday.  The story was rich, the choices felt consequential, and the politics felt well thought out.  

This wasn't groundbreaking new territory, but the subject matter was fresh, and the story hooked me well enough to get me to put down my other games and play through it, once I got started. That tells me something about how good it was.

184480413.review:
Dont Buy this.

The game is bugged to the point of being unplayable, and the non-bugged version is no good to boot.

Game ending bugs that are in the discussion boards as far back as 2017, still not fixed in the game and the developers suggested workaround doesnt work.

Combat system is trash.

The storyline is too rigid.

maybe the build system is good, the bugs wouldnt let me get that far. From what I did play, it was not optimal for the pace of the game at all.

Wasted my time on this.

EDIT: I requested a refund on this game. I have however many games, and this is a first for me. Truly an enjoyable experience that somehow still managed to disappoint even further in the end.

184310126.review:
The story in Expeditions: Viking appealed to me and picks up pace from the middle of the game to a successful conclusion. The dialogues are mostly well done, although hardly voiced. Most tasks are fun and fit well into the story. The brutal era is well conveyed, and you can (but don't have to) participate in it.

The 4 archetypes do not limit the gameplay options: there are many ways to distribute the skills to the playable characters and thus adapt them to your own play style. Unfortunately, skill points already assigned cannot be redistributed. In this regard, the game is quite unforgiving. The tactical battles were well balanced and, with the exception of the outpost conquests, varied, so that different tactics can be used.

The strategic part caught me a bit off guard, so I couldn't achieve the main goal of the game on the first run. It is highly recommended to keep the hints at the beginning of the game in mind. The game doesn't hold the player's hand much: it was a tough time, and wrong decisions have to be paid for dearly. No mercy is shown to the player here either... but in the end, not everyone can become a viking, right?

The game has some weaknesses, but they are not too serious: collecting resources sometimes becomes a test of patience and requires camera panning; it cannot be zoomed out very far; the troop has to be reassembled before each battle; assigning new abilities to the hotbar is tedious.

Nevertheless, a clear recommendation from me if you like tactical & turn-based games, the viking setting, and role-playing games.

half an hour into the game i was foolish enough to think i would have time to get "help" on my quest the next morning to find myself in a heated battle just to loose unbelievably bad and then... got surprised with unexpected character depth.
Im intrigued
